title: VCVTUDQ2PS â€” Convert Packed Unsigned Doubleword Integers to Packed Single-Precision Floating-Point Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VCVTUDQ2PS xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2/m128/m32bcst`
`VCVTUDQ2PS ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2/m256/m32bcst`
`VCVTUDQ2PS zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2/m512/m32bcst{er}`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Converts packed unsigned doubleword integers in the source operand (second operand) to single-precision floating-point values in the destination operand (first operand).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512/256/128-bit vector broadcasted from a 32-bit memory location. The destination operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Note: EVEX.vvvv is reserved and must be 1111b, otherwise instructions will #UD.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
